items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are high but stable on the Ginge Brook following persistent rainfall earlier in the week. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 22/11/24, especially in the areas closest to the Ginge Brook near Steventon. The forecast is for a predominantly dry day before low pressure brings persistent and at times heavy rainfall from the early hours of Saturday. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly today but levels are likely to respond again to Saturday's rainfall. We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening, 22/11/24, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain elevated but are falling slowly on the Tern - Walcot river gauge as a result of recent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from Friday 22/11/24 over the next few days. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem and Rodington.   
Light showers are forecast in the next 24 hours. Further heavy rainfall is forecast from Saturday 23/11/24
We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 17:00 on 22/11/24, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bracknell Forest, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
 
River levels are steady on the Chertsey Bourne, and flooding of low lying land and roads is still possible this evening, 21/11/2024, especially in the Free Prae Road area of Chertsey.  Tomorrows forecast is for drier conditions, but turning wetter at the weekend. 
 
We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 22/11/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because flooding of homes and businesses is likely today, Friday 22nd November, and for at least the next 24 hours. The forecast high tide at Great Yarmouth will restrict the Broads river system from draining out to sea, which will result in higher than normal water levels within the Broads. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Saturday 23rd November, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. No significant rainfall is forecast in the next 24 hours, but heavy rainfall is forecast this weekend, and we will re-issue the flood alert if necessary. We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the sea has now reduced, however, there may still be large waves and strong winds, so take care near coastal paths and promenades.

items.description: Riverside properties on the River Thurne including Hickling Broad
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The current forecast is for no further flood risk from high tides. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.
